handist.collections.accumulator

Class Accumulator<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • handist.collections.accumulator.Accumulator<A>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - the "accumulator" type used to keep information about the modification to be performed on the target ChunkedList
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccumulatorCompleteRange

    public abstract class Accumulator<A>
extends Object
    Class representing a factory for accumulator instances dedicated to a single thread.

    This allows for multiple threads to record information in a thread-dedicated ChunkedList<A>, with each A object "accumulating" information with regards to the "T" object at the matching index in the target collection.

    Computation with an accumulator takes place in 3 phases:

    1. An Accumulator with a certain accumulator-allocation policy is created. the type A used to accumulate information and how to initialize new instance of this A type are specified to the constructor.
    2. This accumulator is used in one or multiple accumulation calls where the information contained in some collection is used as the source to register information into the accumulator objects contained by the Accumulator
    3. The information accumulated in the Accumulator is used to update some collection's elements using method ChunkedList.accept(Accumulator, java.util.function.BiConsumer) or ChunkedList.parallelAccept(Accumulator, java.util.function.BiConsumer). The function which determines how to update individual T elements of the target collection based on the information contained in the A accumulators is specified as parameter to these functions.

    There is currently one implementation of Accumulator:

    • AccumulatorCompleteRange which prepares accumulators for all the ranges it is given at the time of construction. Use this variant if you know that the elements processed during the accumulation phase will need to record information about (almost) all indices contained in the target ChunkedList<T>.
    Author:
    Kawanishi Yoshiki

    • Method Detail

      • getAllThreadLocalAccumulator

        public List<Accumulator.ThreadLocalAccumulator<A>> getAllThreadLocalAccumulator()
        Obtain all currently initialized thread-local accumulators.
        Returns:
        all thread accumulators initialized by this instance up until this point

      • newThreadLocalAccumulator

        protected abstract Accumulator.ThreadLocalAccumulator<A> newThreadLocalAccumulator()
        Factory method which creates a new ThreadLocalAccumulator for an upcoming thread to use to accumulate information.

        This method is for internal use only. It is used when there are not enough thread-local accumulators for the level of parallelism desired. Each Accumulator implementation should implement this method to return a Accumulator.ThreadLocalAccumulator instance fitted with its appropriate accumulator allocation policy.

        Returns:
        a newly created

      • obtainThreadLocalAccumulators

        public List<Accumulator.ThreadLocalAccumulator<A>> obtainThreadLocalAccumulators(int nbAccumulators)
        Obtain the specified number of thread-local accumulators. These can then be used by as many threads to accumulate information without interfering with each-other.

        Previously allocate thread-local accumulators will be re-used by this class. Only in a case where more accumulators then previously initialized are demanded will new TLAs be allocated.

        Parameters:
        nbAccumulators - number of accumulator desired
        Returns:
        list of accumulators containing as many

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Discards all initialized accumulators prepared up until this point. Call this method if you plan to re-use this Accumulator again for a new computation.
